meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error in something
meanings.sent1: She keeps flawing her math homework by forgetting to carry over the numbers.
meanings.sent2: He is always flawing his lines during the school play rehearsals.
meanings.sent3: The robot flawing its calculations ended up serving ice cream instead of coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice flawing with emotion touched the hearts of everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The chef flawing the recipe added too much salt, making the dish inedible.

meanings.definition: To reveal a defect or imperfection in something
meanings.sent1: The bright sunlight flawing the cracks in the old wall made them more visible.
meanings.sent2: The new microscope is capable of flawing even the tiniest imperfections in the diamonds.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keen eye flawing the hidden clue led to solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush flawing the canvas with bold strokes created a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The mirror flawing every blemish on her face made her feel self-conscious.
